docs.lead_paragraph: This essay is the second of two parts about the marketing of a first novel and the beginning of a writer's career. "Art must be practiced as a trade, at all events in our time. This is the age of trade." George Gissing "New Grub Street" (1891) WHEN Marly Rusoff is lucky, a book sells itself. When she's not, a handle can be hard to come by.

headline.main: Reader by Reader and Town by Town, A New Novelist Builds a Following
